text.section:
The Board shall reinstate the license of an individual who, for any reason, has failed to renew the license, if the individual:
applies to the Board for reinstatement within 2 years after the license expires;
meets the renewal requirements of § 9-309 of this subtitle; and
pays to the Board a reinstatement fee set by the Board.

section.section:
If an individual has failed to renew a license for any reason and then applies to the Board for reinstatement more than 2 years after the license has expired, the Board may:
require the individual to reapply for a license in the same manner that an applicant applies for an original license under this subtitle; or
subject to paragraph (2) of this subsection, reinstate the license.

The Board may reinstate a license under paragraph (1)(ii) of this subsection, if the individual:
meets the renewal requirements of § 9-309 of this subtitle;
if required by the Board, states reasons why reinstatement should be granted; and
pays to the Board a reinstatement fee set by the Board.

text.section: The Board may waive a reinstatement fee for a licensee who provides evidence satisfactory to the Board that the licensee did not practice landscape architecture during the time the license lapsed.
